meanings.definition: The state or condition of being a fogey.
meanings.sent1: In the retirement home, fogeydom was evident as the elderly residents reminisced about the good old days.
meanings.sent2: His stubborn adherence to tradition showcased his fogeydom in the modern world.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa's fogeydom was on full display when he insisted on using a rotary phone.
meanings.sent4: The fogeydom of the old building stood out in the midst of the sleek, modern skyscrapers.
meanings.sent5: The fogeydom of the antique shop transported visitors back in time.

meanings.definition: The attitudes, behavior, or beliefs characteristic of a fogey.
meanings.sent1: Her fogeydom was evident in her disapproval of new technology.
meanings.sent2: The professor's fogeydom was apparent in his preference for traditional teaching methods.
meanings.sent3: Despite his young age, his fogeydom shone through in his love for vinyl records.
meanings.sent4: The fogeydom of the committee members clashed with the innovative ideas of the young entrepreneurs.
meanings.sent5: The fogeydom of the town council led to resistance against any changes in the community.
